availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Speed Pirtle (Louisville Banker and Attorney.)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, banker and attorney. Louisville native. Son of Henry Pirtle and Jane Anne Rodgers Pirtle. Married to Emily Bartley Pirtle. Father of Robert T. Pirtle, Jane Pirtle, William B. Pirtle, and Emily Pirtle. Graduated from Louisville Male High School. Graduate from University of Louisville Law School. Practiced law in partnership with George W. Caruth. Unsuccessfully ran for a legislative seat on the Democratic ticket in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Alwin Seekamp, Roger Burlingame, eds. Who’s Who in Louisville (Lousiville, The Louisville Press Club, 1912), 178.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 5, p. 119.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016198, Jefferson County Deaths.
"Well Known Citizens," The Courier-Journal, August 17, 1884, p. 12.
Find A Grave, "Judge James Speed Pirtle (November 8, 1840-September 25, 1917)," Memorial #69115646, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69115646 (accessed July, 11, 2017).
